channel.title: Art on darkvolumes
channel.description: Recent content in Art on darkvolumes

item.title: On Sculpture - from "Stranger In A Strange Land"
item.description:
On Sculpture

Extract from “Stranger In A Strange Land”

‘Enough statues to fill a graveyard!’
‘Please, Ben. ‘Statues‘ are dead politicians at boulevard inter-
sections. What you see is ‘sculpture.‘ And please speak in a low,
reverent tone lest I become violent… for here we have exact
replicas of some of the greatest sculpture this naughty globe has
produced.’
‘Well, that hideous thing I’ve seen before… but when did you
acquire the rest of this ballast?’
Jubal ignored him and spoke quietly to the replica of La Belle
Heaulmière. ‘Do not listen to him, ma petite chére — he is a bar-
barian and knows no better.’ He put his hand to her beautiful
ravaged cheek, then gently touched one empty, shrunken dug. ‘I
know just how you feel… but it can’t be very much longer.
Patience, my lovely.'

item.title: Antiques - Unique Pieces
item.description:
Antiques - Unique Pieces

Brafa 2022

Skeleton of an Ice Age woolly rhinoceros

The fossil was entrusted to the Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences in Brussels.




Medusa pendant

This masterpiece, created by Philippe Wolfers, is internationally recognized as an icon of Art Noveau jewellery. The pendant will be preserved in the Brussel Museum of Art and History.




Art Noveau-style pedestal, made from bronze and fossilised wood

Victor Horta designed this piece for the winter garden of his house. Thanks to the acquisition by the Charles Vreeken Fund it returned to its original place within Horta’s house, where the Horta Museum is now located.

item.title: Design Chairs
item.description:
Design Chairs

A selection of design chairs, by chronological order.


1925 Gerrit Rietveld - Red and Blue Chair




1925 Marcel Breuer - Wassily Chair




1928 Le Corbusier - Chaise Longue




1948 Charles and Ray Eames - La Chaise




1956 Nelson - Marshmallow Sofa




1957 Arne Jacobsen - Drop Egg and Swan


1963-65 Eero Aarnio - Globe Chair




1972 Frank Gehry - Wiggle Side Chair
